title: BREAKING GROUND AND STARTING A NEW GARDEN-PREPARING #garden

tasks.task: Prepare a garden plot that is new ground and unattended for many years.
subtasks: Use a John Deere tractor with a four-foot wide disc to till the ground.
Ensure the tillage is thorough, even on hard and compact soil.
Test the pH of the soil and adjust with lime and fertilizer.
Remove rocks, sticks, and other debris from the garden plot.

tasks.task: Expand garden plot to account for seasonal challenges and crop rotation.
subtasks: Plan garden layout with rows close together for efficient space use.
Cover the garden plot with a raised bed to prevent grass growth.

tasks.task: Create a border for the garden plot.
subtasks: Use the tractor disc to create a straight line boundary.
Ensure the border is visible and well-defined.

tasks.task: Demonstrate proper use of a tiller to prepare new ground.
subtasks: Hire a professional service to till the ground effectively.
Address unexpected weather conditions (rain) that may affect tillage.

tasks.task: Discuss concerns about Roundup and Roundup-ready seeds.
subtasks: Explain the dangers of Roundup residue in soil.
Promote organic gardening practices despite limited resources.
